review: We were a group of 12 staying at the Hilton 2Home next door and decided to go sit down rather than order in. I'm not sure if all Red Robin's are this way or if it's just this one but there are minimal seating options for a party our size. In fact we only saw 2 areas that could accommodate parties bigger than 6 or 8. We were told it would be 30 minute wait so we chose to stay but it turned in to a 60+ minute wait. The wait might not have been so frustrating if we would have been provided periodic updates or even offered to split up our group but that didn't happen and we saw group after group get seated while we waited. After the 3rd or 4th time of us asking, it was finally explained to us that they only had 1 place they could seat us and it was currently occupied by another group. When we finally were seated, we did have a great waiter (I don't remember his name) who did a great job lightening the mood of our hangry table. The food did take a while to get to us but when it did, it was good. The bottomless fries kept coming and the portion sizes were decent.  Would I try Red Robin again? Yes but not with a large party.

We had dinner there Tues night the 2nd of Jan.  The waitstaff  appeared to be anything but happy to be there.  Had to wait to be seated and there was no one there.  Sat and waited a goodly time before I caught someones eye and finally we were served.  I ordered the Taco Double Burger and was hoping it would look somewhat like the pic on the menu.  Nope.  Not at all.  There was supposed to be guac and little taco chip pieces.  There was probably a tsp or less of guac and 5 little pieces of taco chip.  1 thin slice of tomato. The meat was double...paper thin and grey.  My husbands burger looked as sickly as mine.  I have had fantastic burgers at this location before but it seems the quality and customer service is going down the toilet.  We may find another location but I`m not even sure I will ever go back to Robin.

My second time at a Red Robin. Not yummmmm! They've got good fries going for them, but when service is lacking, not even bottomless fries can counteract a negative experience. The food? The burger was just okay. It seemed as if ingredients were just slopped on without much regard to what was being made. Our dipping sauce was sent out with some sort of reddish substance in it. It's as if they make it a habit of serving items without inspection. When we flagged down the waitress to notify her of this issue, she asked twice if we had dipped it in the BBQ and then into the garlic aioli. Both times we answered no. Hold up! What?! What the fudge?! For serious! What reason do we have to lie about sauce? She didn't say it upfront, but we knew that she thought we had dipped our fries in BBQ, then the aioli. She simply didn't want to go and get another cup of aioli. It was insane!  Anyway, don't come here. If you must come here, come when it's dead. Maybe you can get better service then. Don't want to overwork the servers by asking for some dipping sauce that isn't tainted.

Stopped by for dinner here tonight - plenty of parking out front although this is shared with other businesses. If parking out front is not available then there is basement parking.  I will start with the bad first - food service was quite slow. I was eating with two others who's food came a good 15/20 minutes before mine. I also ordered a second beer which after waiting for another 15/20 minutes our server came up to us and said that he had totally forgotten I asked for another.  The good - food tasted great. I ordered the gourmet cheese burger with Swiss cheese. This really was great and I would definitely order again. The fries were also bottomless and the beer selection was good (including some great local brews). Our server although slow was very nice. I think he looked like he needed some other staff to help out as he was very busy.  If they can sort out the few issues with their service then this would be a really great place to eat and I will probably be back here at some point.

Was packed on a Saturday evening, that we waited about 30 minutes for a party of 2. Finally seated and food was good as always, but service was incredibly slow. Our waitress ignored us for a good part of our meal.

Ugh.   Read the horrid reviews and went here anyway.  I was staying at the Hilton next door and just needed something quick.   1 person dining.   3 people working.   Bartender absent from bar, apparently was boxing the to go orders.   My dip was bland and cold, my fries were cold and mushy, and my ranch was warm.  Tried to call and the phone just rang and rang.   If you're staying at the Hilton, look elsewhere!

Completely different experience for lunch today. My server Cooper was on point. He's obviously a seasoned vet of the service industry, and this store is very fortunate to have him. He was genuinely kind, and an adept multitasker - acting as both host as well as caring for his tables. Dare I say he behaved as though he likes his job. That's a real treat as a customer - for me anyway. This would be a 5 star review but I was again slightly underwhelmed by the food. It was perfectly acceptable, but it didn't blow me away. The twin cities is a burger haven - there are much better burgers to be had very near by. But I'll take okay food and amazing service any day over the reverse. Thanks again Cooper.

To start off, walking in we were told 15 minute wait, cause the servers needed a relax time... ummm, ok. Your at work to make money and you can't make tips if you have empty tables. Also within 5 minutes there was 4 people sitting at the host station. You could also see empty tables too. I have pics of the servers at the host station and of the empty tables You can see while sitting in the waiting area. I won't be back, I'll take my $59 elsewhere!
Excellent people working, good burger, fries came out cold and mushy, they hooked us up with fresh ones! Overall a average!

I love French fries and Red Robin is a French fry lovers dream. They have all you can eat French fries. The only thing better would be a French fry buffet. Can you imagine that? French fry buffet. OMG I need to register my Patent. The first time I visited a Red Robin was about a year ago in Colorado. My uncle, grandpa, dad, three brothers and myself went out to lunch while the ladies were doing some shopping. My uncle ordered a bunch of appetizers ahead of our burgers. We had nachos, onion rings, wings and one tray that arrived in the blizzard of appetizers that none of us recognized. Knowing that we were in Colorado and that Colorado is not only partially famous for their fried Rocky Mountain Oysters (we're going to keep this PG as its a food review) they were also on the menu. So while this group of cowardly men stared at this platter and dared someone to try this mysterious fried item, none of us had the "kahunas" to go for it. Thankfully our server arrived and acknowledged that they had brought out a plate of fried mushrooms to the wrong table and that they would be complimentary. I don't recall a plate of anything being eaten that quickly especially after the coast was clear. Anyhow this is where I had my first Whiskey River BBQ Burger. It was really good. The burger comes with cheddar cheese, fried and sautéed onions, shredded lettuce, tomato and mayo along with their BBQ sauce. What's not to like! I've also had the Red Robin Cheeseburger which is also good but in my opinion second to the Whiskey River.  Don't forget those fries.  We were seated right away and before our server arrived another employee who was carrying a serving tray of fries stopped and asked if we would like a bucket of fries. I was in love. So what do you do for a living? "I walk around and hand out baskets of free fries". I so need to change jobs. So while we were working on our first basket our server arrived to take our order. Both my wife enjoy the same burger so we didn't have to look at their menu. We were also celebrating my wife's birthday so she get's her burger for free. After our order was placed our kind server brought out another basket of hot fries. That's basket number 2 for those of your scoring at home. The thing I really like about their fries is their Red Robin seasoning. It's a salty and savory blend that really is good on their fries. It's so good we bought a jar to take home with us. And for $5.00 its a steal. Our burgers arrived with number 3 and we were more than ready. I've had burgers at a lot of different places and this is a darn good burger. As we were wrapping up our server asked if there was anything else she could get us. Even though I had fries in my mouth and in my hand, I contemplated going for 4 but I felt that familiar kick to my shin that reminded me that we were full. Red Robin does have a full menu besides fries and burgers as well as a full bar. Don't forget to sign up for their birthday club as if there is anything better than a burger, its a free burger, and fries!

Very busy location!   Staff was friendly and burgers were prepared as ordered.  Endless fries or Salad. Relatively new when we went -so forgiving on the confusion over who had our table. Three people. Total bill was $68.    Interesting that the server schedules are based on the reviews.  Seams like a fair system to ensure the best servers get hours they like.  A cool system.

You better be craving a burger if you come here - and I'll tell you why! First let's start with the drinks: they're all good and very fruity. They also come in cool shaped cups. For example I world never expect a margarita or Long Island to be poured into a weirdly curved cup, but hey it still tasted pretty good.  If you sign up to be a red robin rewards member, they will send you an email when it's your birthday month, and you can get a free burger (excluding the "finest" burgers). Did I mention BOTTOMLESS FRIES? Come hungry!! Don't get the herb garlic fries, they might be the cheapest but it came out greasy and tasted like a think cut French fry. Instead, try the sweet potato fries! I had a chicken whiskey burger which had fried onions, lettuce shreds (why not a real lettuce piece) cheese and  tomatoes. It was also topped with some delicious sauce but bout enough of it.  These burgers are all very messy. Although they toasted my burger buns, they were easily soggy so I skipped the buns and just ate the rest of the burger.  They have those small screens at your table where you can order more food, drinks or pay with card there.

Have to say that this was not a good dining experience for our family. The soups take a very long time to come out and so did our main courses. The kids had had oranges with their meals, and the little cup only contained about 3/4 slices. So we asked for me. We ordered more fries and the person that brought them over, just placed the basket in front our 3 year old and walked away without any communication. Refills were slow, reactive. We had to ask everyone. Just wasn't a pleasant experience.

Warning: The word Gourmet in the name may cause cognitive dissonance.  There is a reason that there are at least 40 restaurants in Bloomington with a higher rating.  In fact, you can't find any place to eat in the city with a worse rating than this joint.

I usually love Red Robin's, but this one is seriously lacking in taste and service. Had several issues that would have been minor in themselves, but all added up and were not mitigated effectively. Like a server poring ranch dressing all over me, and then just saying sorry and walking away without offering extra napkins or even getting our table silverware (something that should have been a standard question). Told the manager our concerns when he made his rounds, and he said sorry... and then told us to have a good night. I'm not looking for free food, I'm prepared to pay for meals, but he could have showed any type of concern or empathy. On top of that, the food was seriously lacking in taste and quantity. Tiniest portions I've seen at any Red Robin. Overall, not the worse experience I've had at a restaurant, but I certainly won't go back.

Red Robin | $16 southern comfort  1/2 lb. Black Angus patty glazed with brown sugar and topped with candied bacon, honey BBQ sauce, sharp Cheddar, caramelized onions and mayo on a toasted ciabatta bun. Pair with Blue Moon® Belgian White  I added mushrooms too so it cost extra. With an upgrade of garlic fried. Soooo yum! Little but of pink in the middle  juicy, flavorful, usually I'm not a BBQ sauce fan, but this charm won me over. Service at this Red Robin is always on point too! Managers are very active with their diners & being on the floor.  #southerncharm #redrobin #redrobingourmetburgers #greasyfood #cheatday #nationalburgerday #junkfood  #thisismyminnesota #minnstagram #foodgasm #capturemn #captureminnesota #goodeats #tryitordiet #minneapoleats #letsfork #forkedup #foodbeforedudes #foodie #foodstagram #foodporn #foodtography #instafood #instaeats #foodblogger #exploremn #exploreminnesota #thisismymn #capturemn #captureminnesota

This Red Robin was such a disappointment!  I unfortunately didn't read the reviews before deciding to eat here!  I stayed at the Hilton next  door and had crabby children and husband!  I wi say normally I love Red Robin, the Blue Ribbon Burger is one of my favs... a little pink turned into almost raw! I removed the portion of my bun and could actually see pink on the outside of the party where I am pretty sure it did not touch the grill!  The thin cut fried onions were more of a ball of gooey doughy onion, enough to the extent that I grabbed a menu to see if they had changed the description, they were that bad!!    I would have loved to tell my waitress but with kids o couldn't wait any longer!  Handy thing with the portable kiosk on the table they don't actually have to return to get paid these days!!   I would look else where even if you are desperately hungry and staying at the hotel!  Don't let the 10 steps to the entrance fool you!!

I know management probably won't care about this negative review since they don't seem to care about anyone's awful experiences here.  First off, when we walked in to be seated, the host said she needed to clear off a table for us. We waited at least 15 minutes to be seated in an entirely empty restaurant. We then proceeded to wait another 10 minutes for the waitress to even come over and greet us and take our drink order. It took so long for the waitress to bring us our drinks, that another waitress came over to see if we've been served. Our original waitress proceeded to scream across the restaurant saying that she had already gotten our drink order. While we were eating, I had accidentally dropped my phone under the table. To my surprise (or rather now looking back at it, not very surprising at all) the floor was absolutely DISGUSTING. There was old food and dirty napkins all over the floor. Will never step foot into a Red Robin again.

I've been to other RB locations before, but decided to try this one out since it's closer to me.  We both ordered the freckled lemonade. Which tasted the same as any other RB we've went to.  I ordered the Royal red robin burger?? (I forgot what the name was LOL) - anyways, it's the only one with an egg on it...I think? We also had another order of their Whisky ---something burger. Can't remember that one either.  Food was 3.5/5 - I still see it as a normal burger. I don't think it's anything too amazing.  We came here around the time they opened, so it wasn't too busy. The only thing that was bothersome was how loud the hosts were since they placed us practically right next to them, when they entire restaurant was open. Other than that, it's not big deal. It's a huge restaurant and it's very clean (just opened, duh).  Service here was pretty good? I wouldn't think it was a 5/5. I'd call it a 4/5 for service, but I understood from the servers point of view. She had all of her tables on the other side of the restaurant and had to run over to tend to us on the other side.

BBQ burger and bottomless garlic steak fries were excellent.  Orange cream soda overfilled with ice and just orange soda and sprite with whipped cream...most upsetting is the $1.99 "entertainment fee" for the lame tablet to distract kids. Children can accept without any parental consent bringing unexpected fees to the final bill. Strange business practice to have hidden fees at restaurant.....

Had lunch here with my daughter, she got the "name this chicken sandwich"  & a malt.  I ordered the guacamole, salsa & chips with a side salad w/ thousand island.  the chips were super salty, salad was ok.  my daughters sandwich was really good & the malt.  They were giving out free baskets of fris, so that was a nice surprise.  interior was fun & clean.  Good service, maybe a little to good, but they just opened so I think they are trying a bit to hard at the moment, it got annoying.  There is an electronic device on each table  you can play games (you need to pay for) order more food, drink or pay your bill.  while that is nice and convenient, ummm ewww how dirty & full of germs will those get?!

Slower than molasses! I had to wait 20 minutes at one point, after I had finished eating, before my server finally came back to check on me. Meanwhile, a half dozen other servers were milling around trying to look busy. The food was great but really lousy service overall the last  couple times I have gone.

Colorful menu pages are covered with FROSTED plastic sleeves! And w/ serving descriptions in small type, viewed in dim light- makes them practically unreadable! Had to pull them out, hold them at a close angle to barely see / read the darn things!

We were able to enjoy Red Robin's 'soft' opening on November 18th and really had a nice time!  It has a nice 'feel' to it and I can see myself meeting friend's for lunch and or cocktail while sitting in the bar area.
Pretty average like an Applebee's for burgers. They have Surly on tap, which is nice.

Wow. I have a Red Robin rewards card. I work in Shoreview so I have only been to that location. I love their burgers and sweet potato fries. So, tonight I decided to order from Door Dash. My nearest location is Bloomington. I ordered my usual burger and the mac & cheese entree for my 16-year-old son. He chose onion rings as his side. It just arrived and there is barely any mac and cheese and there are 5 onion rings. I can understand the small number of onion rings, even though I paid $1.49 extra for them. However, there was a small scoop of mac and cheese in a small container. It didn't even fill the container. Maybe an ice cream scoop. This is a side, not an entree. Pathetic. Will not patronize again.

Red Robin is always delicious in my opinion, but this location went above and beyond.  My mom is vegan, and while Red Robin offers vegetarian versions of their burgers finding a vegan one can be hard.  The restaurant manager, Chris and our waiter worked with her to find ingredients she could eat so she could build a vegan burger.  It was amazing!

Went on 10/15/16.  Obtained table quickly. Ordered appetizers.  45 minutes later no apperizers. Told by waitress every five minutes that they would be there.  Fianlly asked for check still no appetizers. Check received and billed for appetizers.  Asked for manager she did take off bill after explaining we would not pay for something that we did not receive.

This location obviously needs to work the kinks out. It's my second time at this location and both times they have forgotten my bacon on my sandwich. This time around they cooked my husbands burger with part of the parchment papers that separate the patties.
Incredible service and a lot of happy faces. Really fun looking place and good atmosphere. Burgers came out within 10 minutes and were prepared with excellence!

We waited over 20 minutes to have a wait staff greet us after we were seated.  Finally a waitress from another section took pity on us and took our order. 2 times the manager came to apologize.. But our wait staff did not come.  When we finally did get our order.. the burgers were cold and the kid's meal was hard and cold too.  The restaurant was mostly empty on a Saturday night.

We are visiting from TX & we looked at the Yelp reviews for this place-almost didn't come b/c of the negative service comments. We were starving and went for it and couldn't be happier. Our waitress Sara was AMAZING!! She totally made our trip. She told me she usually works in the bar but was helping with tables. She was quick, attentive, totally on top of our order , smiley and kind. She kept our fries full, drinks refilled and made our night. Ask for her next visit.

First few times we went to this location the service was good and the food was also prepared well.  We went back about 2 weeks ago and wondered, at what should have been a busy time, why the restaurant was so empty.  We found out quickly, the poor trainee working with our server was 10 times more attentive, courteous and friendly than the trainer.  No follow up, couldn't get drinks refilled or our check.  Our food was passable, certainly not worth the prices they charge.  Back to Shantytown where the food is always good.

Our server was great but the other servers walking around were pathetic. One gal actually rested her leg in our booth as she chatted with another server. Really? Every female server had butt crack showing at one point, no joke. Food was OK, service was a joke. Zero training and basically zero screening process. Our server was very nice, but never cleared an empty dish

This Red Robin is horrible! I was dining with my family and was served the most disgusting ball of sub par meat I have had outside of a street vendor in Honduras.  I ordered the burning love burger and I swear that it was a floor burger. My mother who was dining with me was served cold sweet potato fries. I wasn't going to raise a fuss, but was just  finished.    The server felt bad and offered me a different burger; I have never understood restaurants offering more bad food to follow what was already served.    I told her it was fine, but the manager Chris came over with a really snotty attitude and gave mom some fresh fries saying" I hope these will be okay, your majesty." She was incredibly condescending and passive aggressive.- but she took my burger off the bill.   The only good things about the visit were the amazing vanilla shake and the kind server.    Do yourself a favor and hit Five Guys instead.

I would give negative stars if possible. I ate the mushroom Swiss burger earlier today, having been the only thing I ate all day. My mushrooms were a bit undercooked. I didn't say anything, thinking I'd be ok. Now I've been puking my brains out for the past 4 hours! I got mushroom poisoning! Anything I try to drink, I immediately vomit right back up. I've vomited more times tonight than I have in 10 years! NEVER EATING THERE AGAIN, or mushrooms!

This location needs to train their staff better. Even the manager walked around with his head in the clouds- not even asking anyone how their meal was going. Things started well enough but when we asked to change seating locations due to crying children then everything went downhill. First, the new booth was dirty and it took three times to get everything clean. The server helped us bring our water to the new table but not the silver wear. We kept asking multiple times to get this plus napkins but no one seemed to care. We finally had to get up and ask at the kitchen then the "manager" got us silver wear and napkins. It took forever to get our food and then my salad didn't have any dressing. They ask you if you want pink in the burgers and we said yes but the burgers were cooked through.  But the burgers were still good as were the rest of the food. Maybe this was a one time incident but after reading the other reviews I don't know. The Red Robin in St Louis Park has better service.

The service was great and burger was truly amazing. The food was a little slow coming out of the kitchen but the manager stopped by the table and apologized without us complaining or anything. Everyone was trying really hard to make the dinner a nice experience.

I'm not so sure why some people are complaining... It is a red Robin... It is not the end-all for hamburgers... But I was pleasantly surprised at this location's size and cleanliness and ability to see this right away... I was also impressed with how cheap it was... I can't believe people say they overcharge for burgers... I got a half pound burger for $10 and it was phenomenal it was the new nachos pub burger... Very tasty and my never ending sweet potato fries were very good... I got a $3.50 Coors Pines on tap which seem pretty reasonable... And this place has tons of TVs... It was a perfect spot to watch the NCAA basketball tournament... My only complaint was that our service was very very slow and they did not have that many tables for each waitress to wait on... so I'm not sure what was taking so long... Our waitress also told us they're "bar was backed up"... I ordered was a beer... And they had two people working the bar... Maybe they just were used to having that many people in the restaurant... But I in general enjoy the ambience of the place... I'm not sure people were complaining about what parking either... There's a giant lot that they share with the shoppingmall in the back... It was pretty easy to park
Food is great, especially Smoke house burger. Only complaint is they are slow. It takes them 35 to 50 minutes to bring you the food. I am going there 3 to 8 times a month and I will continue to go.

The food is good. Cmon, it's Red Robin. The food is good. But the service? Oh my. Unless you have 2 hours, don't stop here. We waited 10+ minutes before they asked for our drink order. A waiter from another section, Cooper, is the only server who noticed us and came to help. He was great. In fact, I give 1 star for the food, 1 for Cooper. Forget the rest.

This was my second time here.  I waited to post a review as I  hoped the first time was just a bad day but the same problems were present as was on my first visit.  The burgers and chicken are very good and served hot but that is the only positive at this restaurant.  I was seated by the hostess who said my waitress would be over shortly.  I was meeting a friend for dinner and had arrived 20 minutes early.  I looked at the menu, decided on my dinner choice and read several pages of a book I had brought with me.  The waitress never showed up to take my drink order until my friend arrived.  The waitress heard me tell my friend that I hadn't seen a waitress yet so wasn't sure when she would be here.  When she came over, she didn't apologize for being late/slow, just took our orders. The fries I received were lukewarm at best.  They were not fresh and tasted like they had sat under a warming light for quite some time.  I had 2 bites left of my sandwich when the waitress came by and asked about the food.  I told her about the fries and she did offer to give me more fries and said some fresh ones would be done shortly but at that point it was too late as my sandwich was almost gone.  She did not offer to deduct anything from the bill for this.  Red Robin should do away with their bottomless fries and lower the prices so they are more in line with Applebee's or TGIF.  I can't imagine many people want seconds of stale, lukewarm fries. She came back later to explain the  bill paying system and our bill was ready.   My friend had to ask her if she could order dessert.  The waitress took her dessert order and left without asking if I wanted anything.   My friend ordered the short stack of mini donuts.  Do not order these.  They are sprinkled with SALT,  not sugar.   Nothing in the dessert description indicates this which can be a serious problem for someone with high blood pressure.

Just went there on Friday night with 6 adults.  We were seated right away and waiter took drink order.  2 waters, 2 alcohol drinks, 2 lemonades.  Waters came about 5 minutes later.  One lemonade came about 5 minutes after that, then the other about 5 minutes later.  After about 15 minutes my husband got his beer.  It took another 5-7 minutes for my wine to arrive.  It took roughly an hour from the time we got there before we even got our food.  When my husband asked for another beer it took about 15 minutes to get it.  Meanwhile a table of 6 and 4 received their food before us when we had been there for a good 15 minutes before they were even seated.  When we complained they told us they had let half the staff leave at 5:15 because they weren't busy.  They also blamed the State Fair.  Even though we complained to both the waiter and the manager on duty they blew us off and never once apologized.  We won't be going there again.  There are far too many excellent places in the area we can go to without ever needing to go back.  Busy is one thing but the total lack of customer service is pathetic.

Been here a few times by default. I usually stay at the Hilton next door for business. When I'm car-less in the winter where I don't want to walk in the cold it's my only option if I'm that hungry or perhaps go in there for a cocktail. This place is probably good for a young crowd. The teenaged, millennials and sort that do not know good quality food and service.  The burgers are frozen patties, fries are way over salted and staff are barley 23 years old. The cocktails are poorly made and over priced. Staff could be slow too even if you're sitting at the bar. Typical corporate chain place. If you're okay with that you'll be okay with this place. They're all the same as I've experienced in my travels from state to state. It's the same for any Red Robin (Chilis, Outback and even worse Applebee's).  In the area if you want a really good pub food with a great quality fresh beef patty burger I'd suggest Lucky 13 down the street. Ask for their Lucky13 tots too.

Came here for a friends birthday-- it was a Tuesday and surprisingly very busy. I've been to the Red Robin in Apple Valley multiple times and was very satisfied so I had the same expectation at this location as well. In short, I'm giving this specific location a 2/5 simply because the burgers and milk shakes were delicious. The service, on the other hand, was atrocious to put it lightly. When we received our food, our waitress must have made the mistake of putting the same burger twice. I received a plain bacon burger instead of the guacamole burger. I gave her the benefit of the doubt since it was busy. I was in a good mood after all. We had not seen our server in a while so we decided to ask another staff member to correct my order. She denies and says "nope, that's the guac burger alright." My partner and I paused, as I was dissecting my burger while waiting for our respective server and knew for a fact that there was zero guac in the burger. She decides to cut us off before we could correct her and say "I'll get you more guac." Strike two for RR since there wasn't any guac in the first place.  She comes back and asks me to check the burger once more. I comply just to prove her wrong, I peel the burger apart and repeat, "I don't see any guac." She drops the container of guac in front of my friends and I, points to the container, and says "there" and walks away. My friends and I look at each other, perplexed at the upright rudeness of that particular staff member. Strike three RR.  My server finally comes by after the other staff leaves our table and asks how the food is tasting. I politely explain that she must've gotten my burger wrong (simply because there was more ingredients missing so I decided to ask for a completely new order of my previous desire.) She quickly apologizes and brings back the right order. Woo, finally. My friend had also ordered a shake with his burger, which came later and... you guessed it! The wrong flavor. Strike four.. My friend decides to roll with it since he knew it would take a while to get the correct one (the shake came at the same time as our check). When I saw his shake I actually wanted one myself, but thought it wasn't worth it since it would probably come half an hour later and be the wrong flavor anyway. We stopped by Sonic for my milkshake which was fast and the right flavor. Moving onto the food: the chefs cooked our burgers to PERFECTION! It was so delicious and so was the guac! I ended up taking the extra guac that was brought to our table by the rude server home to eat it with chips and I have to say I'd bring a whole order of guac home if I could. Anyway I love Red Robin's, however this location was a real let down. TLDR: Service is awful, burgers are good! Although not enough to make me come back.. to this location anyway.

I understand that you can't expect much from a restaurant chain but I was hoping for bit of consistency, boy I was surprised. Not a really good and welcoming Red Robin location and I have been to a few before.  Our service was superficial, food was not prepared per our instructions, no follow up on our drink or food orders, and incompetency from hostess to server to the manager throughout our experience.  Here is some details for those who would like to know more. 1- Hostess told us to wait before she can sit us but the restaurant was like 50% empty, apparently putting us in the worst possible table as possible, was her goal; with no napkins, no silverware, no view of tv and on only table with no electronic hub 2- server was efficient in taking over order we order 2 drinks with free refills (never got free refills), order 3 entrees with bottomless side (never received refills on those either) 3- order salad with specific instructions for no Bacon, when I got my order it had bacon all over it, even though server wrote it down and repeat it back to me.  When I notified our server she apologized and manager personally came to redelivered my order saying that he had it remade from scratch and I believed him.  I begin eating the salad and ate about 1/4th but when I flipped the chicken piece over I found pieces of bacon under the chicken that were left when they simply scrape off the bacon from the salad (see picture). By this time we were completely turned off by their in competencies and started to recollect our experience since the moment We walked in.  This Red Robin is one of the worst restaurant when it comes to customer service, food preparation and quality control checks.

I've been to several red robins before and have always been in love with them. I mean come on, who can go wrong with bottomless fries?!  My mom and I decided to go here for lunch on New Years Eve. We arrived and they attempted to sit us in the most akward table in the bar that was right next to the pos. We had to ask to be moved because it was just way to akward and there was a abundance of tables open. We were moved to a different table and shortly after our server came.  They have these neat tablets on the table. Obviously they are a opportunity for revenue because you can buy your kids games to keep them occupied. In addition you can order apps and desserts but that is it. At the end you pay on this. That is where the issue comes in...we didn't use it out of choice, because it was FILTHY! Apparently they do not wipe these down. I was so terrified that touching it would give me a cold that is going around the local day care.  We ordered our food and of course they come with bottomless fries. The serving (because of this) is usually very small. Somehow the waitress was MIA. We slowed down but just wanted more fries. Its like she knew we wanted more fries so she avoided us.  The service was mediocre at best. The cleanliness was bad. Given that this is a brand new location, I really expected it to still be new looking on the inside as well.

I'll just get to the point: this location sucks.  Our hostess was clearly bored and uninterested in her job, sealed with a wide open mouth yawn and an uninspired "enjoy your meal".  Our server informs us he'll be right with us. And "right with" means ten minutes later with water. When he finally does take our order it's on a napkin.  For whatever reason a second server brings us our food. When I ask her for the ketchup bottle on a nearby table- as our table had none- she says "oh, I'll bring you a new bottle", then doesn't. Never saw her again.  And forget about a beverage refill. I mean you can get one, but you'll be waiting longer than what I would consider a reasonable time. At least the server acknowledged and apologized for this.  On the way out some hoodlum was laying on his back in a booth, playing with his phone, feet out in the isle, solidifying my low opinion of this establishment.  Oh, and the food- it was ok. I thought $11 was a little much for four smallish chicken strips that were on par with say Culvers, but it wasn't terrible. Just over-priced with shitty service.  All in all I got McDonald's quality service with food that was marginally better. Needless to say I wouldn't recommend this location nor will I be spending another dime here. Too bad the management ignores these reviews, hence neglects to correct their problems.

Came here for lunch and the service was incredibly slow. Once our food arrived, mine was wrong. Once I finally got the correct burger, it was good... but, there are plenty of places around here with good burgers and much better service.

The server was really nice but my burger was made incorrectly. By the time they fixed it my friend was done eating, for a 10-15 minute wait to fix your mistake it should've been on the house. I thought that was common sense but apparently not.

1st time here & our waitress Amy was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Burgers were delicious, onion rings with Tavern sauce and unlimited fries! Will definitely be back. Large space with lots of windows and a nice bar.

So the shtick here is hamburgers with fancy names on fancy buns, hence "gourmet" so they can charge more. The burgers are fine, although I don't expect a "gourmet" burger to so obviously look like a machine formed, frozen burger. The buns ARE good, but maybe not worth all the fame and attention they get. Service was fine, no problems there. We left with the same impression from past visits to other Red Robins. It's okay but for the money spent there are better meals to be had.

My husband Richard and I were in Red Robin last weekend and we had a fantastic server!! Her name was Alli. Being that my husband and I have ate out over 200 times this year we received the best service by Alli. She was always checking on us, not to much, but enough. Constantly had our sodas refilled, got us our bottomless fries very fast! We even heard ask over 6 times for a fry refill to the kitchen! She was making sure we got them fries!  There was not one thing wrong with her or anything else. Except the bathrooms being compleltey messy that's about it! I do hope Alli gets recognized for this message! We didn't touch "survey" fast enough on the computer screen so we didn't get to write there!!  Thanks Alli we will be back!

I usually have a great time at Red Robin's. I mostly go to the one in Apple Valley, but this was my first time at this one. And I have to say it was a pretty good experience.  On the weekends, you should always expect to wait for awhile. Today it was a quick five minutes, but when we got to our seats I saw there were plenty of booths still available. Puzzling? Doesn't really matter though. For one, if you don't like burgers, then Red Robin is not the place for you. I had a hard time picking out what to eat, because there were a lot of delicious choices to choose from. I chose the Royal Red Robin btw. We got our food quick, and with the burger and endless fries, everything was great! But with the endless fries, I just expect the employees to come around a lot. We got our second helping of fries after our main meal.  Speaking of the help, everything was fine. The waiter came around a lot, but not for endless fries and the payment of the meal.  Overall, this place is a good choice to go eat.

Very very disappointed at this location. Just went in to get a burger to go and was told that they are not doing To Go orders until the end of December by a very rude bartender, who was super busy cleaning up rather than paying attention to customers.  So disappointed. I mean if I had eaten half my burger there and wanted a box for the rest, they would have told me I basically couldn't do that since they aren't doing To Go orders.

We decided to go here after bowling last week.  We were sat down and waited 10 minutes before anyone took our drink order.   They have small monitors for you to order instead of dealing with a waitress apparently which later on seemed to be the reason the staff was so piss poor.  In order to get a drink we had to get the attention of the bartender (who was very rude) because our waitress was missing for most of the evening.  I guess when you have a tablet to order from the staff gets used to being lazy and not having to do anything.  They are top notch at that here.   So we finally ordered up some burgers.  We were all asked if we would like our burgers to be a little pink in the middle or not and all 6 of us decided to go with pink in the middle.  Unfortunately when the burgers came out all 6 of them were well done...pretty sad.  Then they have endless fries or so they say.  As I said earlier our waitress was nonexistent the entire meal always off somewhere else on her phone or chatting with the other lazy staff.  No one at my table got a chance to get the 2nd helping of fries until 30 minutes after our meal came.  We then waited 15 more minutes for the fries to be delivered.  We each got a basket that came with a whopping 15 fries.   The fries were tasty and that's why 2 stars is the rating.  Aside from that it's a 1 star restaurant all the way.  I would highly advise not going here.  Piss poor wait staff and average food at expensive prices.  Go to Red Cow and be mind blown.

I will not return to this restaurant again. Not clean, chicken strips and fries on the floor. Bathrooms were dirty. Our server seemed to busy to serve us yet he was busing tables. Other employees were standing around socializing with each other. Took forever to get drink refills and fries. My food was like it came from the bottom of the barrel. Our check for 2, $40.00. Not worth it at all.

Literally no service. We were seated tonight for an early dinner with my family of 6. We sat for 30 minutes at the table and not a single person came by to take our order. My brother-in-law even got up to find a server and we were told someone would be right over. NO ONE came. We got up and left, walked right by the manager and all he said was "sorry". We walked to a restaurant near by and got dinner instead.

The new Bloomington location needs more attention on food preparation and the wait serve attention to customers.  Love the Apple Valley location, where everything was well prepared and great wait staff. So, yes to the Red Robin in Apple Valley but do not waste your time at the newly opened Bloomington location.

It's 10:55 in the am and I'm effing starving. My friend, Jen, and I decided to meet for an early 11am lunch. Red Robin is scheduled to open at 11. We get inside at 10:56 and the hosts tell us to have a seat, they don't open until 11am. If you don't open until 11am, then don't unlock your doors until 11am. Another host walks by and reminds us we open at 11. Immediately after that oh so friendly second reminder, a manager informs them they are open and to seat us. Thank you, Sir! A young lady tells us to follow her. She tries to seat us in the bar at a high top for two. Are you kidding me?! The restaurant just opened and we are your first customers, seat us at a booth for heaven's sake! These two person high tops should be your last resort. Jen read my mind and asked her to seat us at a booth. She walks us out of the bar and says, "I don't know what tables are open."  Is she still training? I thought to myself. All the tables are open!!! Finally we reach an OPEN booth, and she tells us she'll be up front if we need anything. Honey, if I need something I will ask my server. What does she think I will go seek her out?  To make a long story short, bottom line is, don't come here to eat or converse with others, unless you like getting interrupted every 47 nanosecconds. I swear we met the entire staff, minus the kitchen. While its nice for them to see our every need is met, we don't need everyone on the payroll stopping by to ask us how the food is, ask us if we need our bottomless steak fries refilled, more water? How 'bout our rewards program?  It was overkill. Lots of staff standing around looking bored when they weren't bombarding our booth. They were very overstaffed.  While the food was good, Robin, I'll stick to the Apple Valley location. Nuff said.
After 10 years I finally tried Red Robin and I am impressed! It's about a 20 minute wait but it was worth it for the food. Service was good too. Try the Sweet Potato fries!

Super disappointing. If the food wasn't so good we would not be going back. The staff acted as though we were invisible and it was not busy at all. On the plus side our burgers were cooked to perfection and when we did flag down another waiter they were friendly and helpful. I would suggest this place but don't be surprised if you get a cold shoulder.

My husband and I thought we'd try out the new Red Robin that just opened a few miles from home. I wish we hadn't. Our server was decent, but it took 45 minutes for our burgers to come out! Not like they had people waiting to get in either. I spotted the food runner trying to deliver our food to a table at the opposite end of the row. Watched him walk back to the kitchen and come out a couple minutes later to our table. When the burgers arrived, they only had fries for one of us. I ordered garlic aioli sauce and it had clearly spilled allover the tray. The runner served me a half empty dip that had sauce allover the outside of the cup. He said he would be back shortly with the fries for my husband. He didn't come back. Finally, after my husband had finished his burger (which was supposed to be some burger loaded with bacon- there were a few tiny crumbles of bacon on it) the server went to track down some fries and didn't bring his dipping sauce. He said it takes a while to make. At this point we had already been there for an hour! At last, he comes out with another tray of fries with cheese melted allover. Why wouldn't he just be honest and say they don't have a cheese dipping sauce?  So, we got charged for extra fries because of it, too. At the end, I ordered a malt from the console on the table to go. When the bartender delivered, there was ice cream and caramel sauce allover the outside of the cup. Come on, Burger King does a better job of serving! For two burgers, a beer, a malt and a side of dipping sauce our bill was $41. I did like my burger, whiskey bbq, but What a rip off. They have some serious kinks to work out. I really was hoping to love this place since it's so close to home.
